action: Scroll 'Scroll down to access the signup form'
observation: I can see a Specter.AI page with a 'Sign Up' button in the header and what appears to be a signup form below with email and password fields. The form elements are quite far down the page (around y-coordinates 1700-2000), which suggests I need to scroll to access them properly.
reasoning: As an elderly user, I need to scroll down to see the signup form elements clearly. The email and password fields are visible in the elements list but are positioned very far down the page. I should scroll down to bring the form into view so I can interact with it more easily.
ux_issues: Form elements are positioned very far down the page, making them hard to access
Small text and form elements may be difficult for elderly users to see and interact with

evidence.actual_outcome: Scroll 'Scroll down to access the signup form'

issues: Form elements are positioned very far down the page, making them hard to access
Small text and form elements may be difficult for elderly users to see and interact with

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: The scroll action removed the two form input fields (green and pink outlined boxes) that were visible in the BEFORE screenshot. No signup form is visible in the AFTER screenshot - only the header with Specter.AI logo and Sign Up button remains.
dual_diagnosis.diagnosis: Scrolling down caused the signup form elements to disappear instead of revealing or progressing the signup flow. The form fields that were present have been scrolled out of view without any new content appearing.
